Utterance: Welcome back! How was your week?
Hi! It was okay. I actually looked into a couple of internships!
That’s fantastic! How did that feel?
It felt good to take action. I found a couple of places that seem interesting.
That’s wonderful to hear! What kind of internships did you find?
One is at a local elementary school, and the other is with a nonprofit that works with kids with special needs.
Both sound like great opportunities! Have you applied yet?
I haven’t submitted anything yet, but I plan to this weekend.
That’s a great plan! What’s holding you back from submitting?
I guess I’m just nervous about the application process.
That’s completely normal. Would you like to talk through any concerns you have about applying?
I just worry that I won’t stand out or that they won’t want me.
It’s natural to have those thoughts. Remember, you have valuable skills and experiences to share. What makes you a good fit for these positions?
Well, I have my degree in child development, and I’ve worked with kids before in tutoring.
Exactly! Those experiences are what will set you apart. It might help to highlight those in your applications. Would you like to practice how to frame your experiences?
Yeah, that could help.
Let’s say you’re writing your cover letter. How would you describe your experience with tutoring?
I’d say something like, “I have experience tutoring children in various subjects, which helped me develop my communication skills.”
That’s a solid start! You can also emphasize your passion for working with children and your commitment to special education.
That makes sense.
Great! How are you feeling about your living situation this week?
It’s still the same, honestly. I haven’t talked to my roommates yet.
That’s okay. It can take time to find the right moment. What do you think is holding you back from having that conversation?
I think I’m just overthinking it. I don’t want to hurt their feelings.
That’s understandable. It’s important to be kind, but it’s also important to express your needs. Would it help to practice that conversation again?
Yes, I’d like that.
Okay, let’s role-play. Start with how you’d greet them.
“Hey, can we talk for a minute?”
Perfect! Now, how would you express your feelings?
“I’ve been feeling a bit lonely living here and would love to connect more.”
That’s a great way to start. It’s honest and non-confrontational. How do you think they might respond?
I hope they’d be understanding.
I think they will be. It’s a conversation worth having. Remember, you deserve to feel comfortable in your living space.
Thanks for the encouragement.
Of course! As we wrap up today, what’s one goal you’d like to focus on for next week?
I want to submit those internship applications and have a conversation with my roommates.
Those are excellent goals! Let’s check in on your progress in our next session.
Okay, I’ll do my best.
I believe in you! Have a great week, and I’m looking forward to hearing about your experiences.
Thanks, Ellie! Bye!
Bye!
